name: European Business Association Armenia
headAddress: P. Byuzand 3, Royal Classic House Business Center 4rh floor
goal:
The main objective of EBA is to support representatives of European Business Community in Armenia and facilitate the integration and cooperation between Armenia and the European Union as well as to improve business environment, encourage foreign investments and improve corresponding legislative framework.

The EBA is functioning as a voice of EU businesses in Armenia to direct their needs toward Armenian authorities and advocating their interests for the elimination of corresponding obstacles. The EBA is promoting fair, open and productive relationship between business and the government. As a result it provides enhancement of competitiveness of the private sector through company capacity strengthening, increasing the transparency of governance and the business environment. At the same time the EBA is increasing the level of integration and cooperation of Armenian and European companies through conducting appropriate activities for enlarging business connections, distributing information on corresponding requirements (certificates, quality control and standards, licensing, etc.) and other activities. The EBA is periodically organizing conferences, seminars business meetings, networking events for local and EU businesses operating in Armenia. Based on companies’ need assessment EBA is making proposals to the government on legislation issues that can potentially improve business climate in Armenia. EBA is advocating the interests of EU and local organizations that have impediments and meet some difficulties in legal, tax, customs or any other sphere of activity.
Our objectives:

Business environment improvement
Public-Private Dialogue platform development
Advocacy of businesses’ rights on a fare platform
Improvement of investment climate and support of foreign investors
Facilitating of integration and cooperation of Armenian and European companies
Improvement of legislation framework
Strengthening business development skills of companies
Events and networking opportunities
How we do this:

We listen to the businesses we represent (mainly EU) and beyond through surveys
We produce or contribute to evidence based analysis and develop concrete recommendations (legislative framework and its enforcement)
We advocate through Public-Private Dialogue platforms and contribute to the improvement and development of an effective B2G dialogue and monitoring
We facilitate the cooperation among Armenian and European business community and beyond through events and networking and coalition opportunities.
interests: Agriculture and Rural Development, Banking and financial services, Business and Industry, Competition, Customs, Economy, finance and the euro, Energy, Food Safety, International co-operation and development, Taxation, Trade, Youth
